error.parsing-notification-config: Your notification configuration couldn't be loaded. Please contact support.
error.username-invalid-characters: Username must not contain any special characters or spaces
error.name-invalid-characters: Name must not contain any special characters or spaces, and must start with a letter
error.username-too-short: Username must be at least 3 characters long
error.name-too-short: Name must be at least 3 characters long
helper-text.recipient-list-name: List name must be between 3-75 characters, and only contain letters, numbers, spaces or these special characters: .-_:/+@()
label.are-you-sure-you-want-to-disable-t: Are you sure you want to disable this user account?
label.coldchain-high-temp-alerts: Send high temperature excursion alerts when greater than
label.coldchain-low-temp-alerts: Send low temperature excursion alerts when less than
label.coldchain-reminder-alerts: Send follow-up reminders until alert is resolved, every
label.coldchain-message-alerts-resolved: Send confirmation message when monitoring connection is restored
messages.saving-disabled-valid-notificat: Did you mean to enable this notification before you saved it?
messages.saving-enabled-invalid-notifica: To save an enabled notification, it must have valid configuration
messages.cold-chain-no-data-information: Alert will be triggered if no temperature data is received by the server within the specified timeframe
text.telegram-recipient-creation-1: Telegram Recipients are created automatically when you add your Notify Bot to a Telegram group.
text.telegram-recipient-creation-2: For instructions on how to set up your bot and add it to a group, see the docs
text.telegram-recipient-test-message: Use the button below to send a test message to this telegram chat
text.telegram-recipient-edit-name: You can't update the details of a Telegram chat from Notify - update the chat name in Telegram and it will update here automatically!
helper-text.sql-query-parameters: Parameters must be provided in json format for now. For example: {"param1": "string", "param2": "string"}
helper-text.recipient-sql-query: Your sql query must return the following columns: id, name, notification_type, to_address.
helper-text.sql-query: Your sql query can contain parameters, which are created using double curly braces within the query. For example: SELECT * FROM my_table WHERE id = '{{param1}}' AND name = '{{param2}}'
helper-text.reference_name: Reference Name is used to refer to the results of the query in a template. For example: {{reference_name.0.name}} will get the name from the first row of the query results.
messages.confirm-duplicate: Do you want to make a copy of this configuration?
